list.name: Changes
list.comment:
feat: integrate Nginx reverse proxy, static serving and uploads + debug auth issues
- Added nginx service in docker-compose: * serves Angular build from /usr/share/nginx/html * exposes /uploads/ via /var/www/uploads * proxies backend requests to spring-backend:8080 * added /nominatim proxy with User-Agent + Referer headers * added /activate proxy to backend for email activation links * configured CORS headers for /api and OPTIONS preflight handling
- Unified docker-compose: * backend, postgres, redis, rabbitmq, influxdb on shared app-network * volumes for uploads and db persistence * added aliases for backend container (backend-name)
- Backend adjustments: * file serving endpoints now generate correct /uploads/... URLs for nginx * refactored household docs/images endpoints to use base upload path * token generation with id + role claims * updated Spring Security config with permitAll for login/register * added activation link generation: http://localhost/activate?token=...
- Frontend adjustments: * AuthService and Interceptor fixed to use correct token from localStorage * updated calls to backend via /api prefix (through nginx) * adjusted map component to go via /nominatim proxy instead of direct OSM * adjusted file/documentation service to build correct /uploads/... URLs
---
TODO / still broken: - [ ] 401 Unauthorized on login/register when routed through nginx (works locally direct to backend) → need to verify nginx passes Authorization + body correctly - [ ] test OPTIONS preflight for Angular frontend (CORS headers consistency) - [ ] test file serving (docs/images) through nginx alias - [ ] verify email activation link actually reaches backend (nginx /activate route) - [ ] check static Angular assets served with correct MIME types - [ ] cleanup WebSecurityConfig (ensure permitAll works as expected) - [ ] retest OpenStreetMap reverse geocoding through /nominatim with correct headers
---
This commit sets up almost all infrastructure pieces (nginx, docker-compose, uploads, proxies, frontend services), but login/register flow is still failing behind nginx with 401 and requires further debugging.
